list.title: Client applications
list.subtitle: Manage web, mobile, server and IoT applications.

header.title: Client credentials
header.subtitle: Credentials used with OAuth2/OIDC for authenticating against AAC

header.title: API resources and scopes
header.subtitle: Manage API access by enabling scopes for selected resources. Clients will be able to ask and obtain only scopes enabled in this section.

header.title: OAuth2 endpoints
header.subtitle: AAC endpoints for OAuth2 and OpenId Connect.

audit.title: Audit log
audit.subTitle: Review audit log for the current application

header.title: Providers
header.subtitle: Identity providers are used to authenticate users via login. Only enabled (and active) providers will be available for this client.

claimMapping.title: Custom claim mapping
claimMapping.subtitle: Custom mapping for claims generation, executed after token grants. The result will be used as provided to build client responses.

webhooks.title: WebHooks
webhooks.subtitle: Hooks are used to alter the token flow by performing actions and/or web calls

header.subtitle: Manage roles for the client application

hooks.attributeDesc: Provide a function to transform principal attributes during login. Return a valid map with all the attributes
hooks.authFunctionDesc: Provide a function to evaluate an authorization policy during the login flow. Return a boolean true/false to represent a decision

list.title: API resources
list.subtitle: View and inspect resources and scopes.

list.title: Audit events
list.subtitle: Review and inspect events for authentication, access and token usage.

list.title: API services
list.subtitle: Register and manage custom services for APIs.

list.title: Attribute sets
list.subtitle: Register and manage custom attribute sets for users. Each custom attribute set will be available as custom profile for consumption both via profiles api and via token claims, with an associated scope `profile.setidentifier.me`

list.subtitle: View and inspect resources and scopes.

header.subtitle: Claims are used to carry authorization info with access and/or id tokens

mapping.subtitle: Claim mapping function should return fully-qualified claims of the current service ONLY. Service namespace is enforced when claims are added to tokens.
